com.mokiat.data.front.parser

Class MTLMaterial

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mokiat.data.front.parser.MTLMaterial

  • public class MTLMaterial
extends Object
    Represents a single material.
    Author:
    Momchil Atanasov

    • Constructor Summary

      Creates a new MTLMaterial with the specified name

    • Constructor Detail

      • MTLMaterial

        public MTLMaterial()
        Creates a new default MTLMaterial.

        Note: The name of this material will be null which is considered invalid according to the MTL specification.
        One needs to set a name before this material can be serialized or properly used.

      • MTLMaterial

        public MTLMaterial(String name)
        Creates a new MTLMaterial with the specified name
        Parameters:
        name - name of the material

      • MTLMaterial

        public MTLMaterial(MTLMaterial other)
        A copy-constructor that creates a new MTLMaterial based on an existing MTLMaterial.
        Parameters:
        other - material to copy

    • Method Detail

      • setName

        public void setName(String name)
        Sets a new name for this material.

        The new name should not be null though no restriction or validation is placed.

        Parameters:
        name - name of the material

      • getName

        public String getName()
        Returns the name of this material.

        Generally, this value should not be null, though this could happen if the user decided to leave it in such state.

        Returns:
        name of the material

      • getAmbientColor

        public MTLColor getAmbientColor()
        Returns this material's ambient color.

        By default this color will be equal to White.

        You can directly use the returned instance to change the color's values.

        Returns:
        an instance of MTLColor.

      • getDiffuseColor

        public MTLColor getDiffuseColor()
        Returns this material's diffuse color.

        By default this color will be equal to White.

        You can directly use the returned instance to change the color's values.

        Returns:
        an instance of MTLColor.

      • getSpecularColor

        public MTLColor getSpecularColor()
        Returns this material's specular color.

        By default this color will be equal to Black.

        You can directly use the returned instance to change the color's values.

        Returns:
        an instance of MTLColor.

      • getTransmissionColor

        public MTLColor getTransmissionColor()
        Returns this material's transmission filter color.

        By default this color will be equal to Black.

        You can directly use the returned instance to change the color's values.

        Returns:
        an instance of MTLColor.

      • setSpecularExponent

        public void setSpecularExponent(float specularExponent)
        Sets this material's specular exponent.

        This value should generally be a number from 0.0f to 1000.0f.

        Parameters:
        specularExponent - the specular exponent value

      • getSpecularExponent

        public float getSpecularExponent()
        Returns this material's specular exponent.

        This value will generally be a number from 0.0f to 1000.0f.

        Returns:
        the specular exponent value

      • setDissolve

        public void setDissolve(float dissolve)
        Sets this material's dissolve.

        This can better be considered as this material's opacity, where a value of 0.0f indicates a full transparency and a value of 1.0f indicates a full opacity.

        Parameters:
        dissolve - the dissolve value

      • getDissolve

        public float getDissolve()
        Returns this material's dissolve.

        This can better be considered as this material's opacity, where a value of 0.0f indicates a full transparency and a value of 1.0f indicates a full opacity.

        Returns:
        the dissolve value

      • setAmbientTexture

        public void setAmbientTexture(String filename)
        Sets the ambient texture filename.

        If null is specified, then this material will not have an ambient texture.

        Parameters:
        filename - filename of the ambient texture

      • getAmbientTexture

        public String getAmbientTexture()
        Returns this material's ambient texture filename.

        If null is returned, then this material has no ambient texture.

        Returns:
        ambient texture filename

      • setDiffuseTexture

        public void setDiffuseTexture(String filename)
        Sets the diffuse texture filename.

        If null is specified, then this material will not have a diffuse texture.

        Parameters:
        filename - filename of the diffuse texture
